attributes.action: Announce a General Election if Article 50 is revoked.
attributes.background: If Parliament at some point revokes Article 50 then by default a General Election should be held to clear the parliament of those who betrayed the 2016 result.  We cannot have the two major parties who in both 2017 manifestos supported the result of the 2016 referendum.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it's very similar to petitions we already have open. 
 
You might like to sign and share one or more of these petitions. 

Have another general election

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235480

Hold a General Election in April 2019

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/235071

If Theresa May resigns as Prime Minister a general election must be held

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/252449

Immediately the UK does not leave the EU on 29/03/2019, call a general election

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/240407

Make a decision on Brexit and then call a general election

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/249018
